page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY IN HEMEL
page.content: Mr Owen is a{local historian.}On June 3rd 1985 he came to talk to the children of Aycliffe Drive School about Hemel Hempstead. He told us that history is about people, not dates and inventions. He's a kind man who "keeps you on the edge of your seat". Mr Owen used to be a lecturer at Dacorum College and that's how he became interested in{local history.}He has set up several{historic trails and {walks}in the area. He told us about the{old railway}that used to run in our area, how it was used for the local{straw trade.}Straw hats were plaited and made by hand by girls and ladies. Mr Owen also mentioned{Margaret {Lloyd,}who left all her money in trust to help children and young people. The park in Grovehill is named after her.
